name: MediMind
premise: Doctors waste time on bureaucracy and sorting patients' medical information.
description: Mission critical platform that classify structured medical information extracted from raw patient notes data while calculating the total medication cost per patient.

name: VeloSure
premise: As a cyclist, what is the best time to ride your bike in a specific bike lane?
description: Palantir Foundry application that determines safe bike paths while taking into account historical intoxicated road accidents.

name: Classification
premise: Leveraging machine learning in order to classify and determining people's emotions based on their facial expressions.
description: SVM and SVR algorithms provide the ability to classify different emotions, apply regression, and perform clustering.

name: Natural Language Processing
premise: Machine learning can be leveraged in order to solve a puzzle.
description: Clue Game that leverages natural language processing by receiving both audio and text input from the user to identify the culprit.

name: merMaid
premise: Clients rely on either agencies or independent workers, without having a central registry to rate their services and validate their credentials.
description: Uberization of maid services based on location, services provided and ratings. The application uses Redux and postgreSQL.

name: BChainCovid19
premise: There is no assurance that a central entity won't forge or falsify the number of vaccines registered in a given society.
description: An Android application that decentralizes people's COVID-19 vaccines by storing them in a blockchain in Firestore as a registry, while simultaneously keeping users' data anonymous.

name: Chess Game
premise: Maximising OOP concepts and applying design patterns such as Factory, Abstract, Singleton.
description: Java application built from scracth that displays a chess game while using OOP and JVM.

name: GrabCut
premise: It is difficult to identify similar objects when exposed to different backgrounds, such as variations in color, shadows, and noise.
description: A MATLAB project that implements the GrabCut algorithm to identify and classify objects.
